feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: High Wind Watch issued January 02 at 3:23AM AKST until January 03 at 9:00AM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...HIGH WIND WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING THROUGH WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...East to southeast winds 35 to 45 mph with gusts up to 75 mph possible. * WHERE...Interior Bristol Bay, including Iliamna, Koliganek, and New Stuyahok.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued January 02 at 3:17AM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...STRONG WINDS DEVELOPING WITH SNOW AND BLOWING SNOW CHANGING TO RAIN THIS AFTERNOON THROUGH TONIGHT... A strong low pressure system is poised to move along the Aleutian Chain today before entering the southern Bering Sea tonight into Wednesday. Easterly to east-northeasterly winds will pick up this morning and peak with gusts to 55 mph in the afternoon to

entry.title: Winter Storm Warning issued January 02 at 3:15AM AKST until January 02 at 5:00PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM AKST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Moderate to heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 8 inches with highest amounts in Adak. Winds gusting as high as 75 mph. Visibility reduced to one half mile or less at times.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued January 02 at 3:55AM EST by NWS
entry.summary: ...Spotty Freezing Drizzle Early This Morning... Spotty freezing drizzle will be possible in the higher terrain of far eastern Kentucky and may lightly accumulate on elevated surfaces such as overpasses. Mountain passes along the Virginia border, such as US Highway 23 at Pound Pass, may also see some slick spots.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued January 02 at 3:00AM MST by NWS
entry.summary: ...TURNING COLDER WITH ACCUMULATING SNOW EXPECTED THURSDAY AND THURSDAY NIGHT ACROSS NORTHERN AND CENTRAL NEW MEXICO... A colder winter storm system will approach western New Mexico Wednesday night, then cross the state from west to east Thursday and Thursday night before exiting to our east Friday. Accumulating snow is most likely over the Tusas, Jemez and Sangre
